intro: Anthriscus nitens, commonly known as the slender cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady areas and is often found in woodland edges or along stream banks. It produces a slender, hollow stem and has a mild, aromatic scent. Anthriscus nitens is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and can also serve as a food source for certain insects.
